I can't imagine how any sane person could find something positive about Castro's Cuba, but what do I know. This is a personal account of someone in a position to know. Interesting.
 ================================
 
 A Look at Life on The Cuban Inside
 Who's Hurt Most by U.S. Sanctions?
 
 By Diana Marrero
 
 Sunday, May 29, 2005; Page B04
 
 It's tricky being a Cuban American in Cuba. The Cubans don't know quite what to make of you. Take this incident from my trip to the island in March:
 
 (Snip)
 
 http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2005/05/27/AR2005052701728.html

Cuba has many problems, like that was news. Cuba is broke, again, duh! The flipside is that despite embargoes, and constant pressure from the US, Cuba has (just) enough food, good healthcare and education. Compared to other societies that lived under embargoes for less time, such as Iraq, it does amazingly well. Cuba has also exported trained docters to help all over latin america. Cuba would be better off under a democratic government and without the US constantly on its back, but the current communist dictator is better than the old right wing one, or alternatives from South America like Pinochet.
I liked the article very much. One of the best ones written by exile-cubans I`ve ever read.
Yes, I should have mentioned that I rather liked the article too, it just reports what is happening, it's not trying to push an agenda, which is unusual for a Cuban exile.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Another look at Castro's Cuba
